results.title: The Southern edge: marsh and mangroves
results.creator_credit: Michael Vance, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Shows the dependence of Westernport Bay on the fringing salt-marsh and mangroves. We see the organisms of these vegetations in their natural surroundings and in the laboratory. Illustrates the density and diversity of the wildlife, and the changes along a transect from saltmarsh to sea. Narrated by Ross Thompson and introduced by Charles McCubbin.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.

results.title: To the island (Macquarie Island)
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Examines the wildlife on sub-Antarctic Macquarie Island, including seals, penguins, skuas, petrels, cape pigeons etc. Culminates in closeup views of the light-mantled sooty albatross and the synchronous courtship flight of a pair of these birds.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Examines the wildlife on sub-Antarctic Macquarie Island, including seals, penguins, skuas, petrels, cape pigeons etc. Culminates in closeup views of the light-mantled sooty albatross and the synchronous courtship flight of a pair of these birds.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Examines the wildlife on sub-Antarctic Macquarie Island, including seals, penguins, skuas, petrels, cape pigeons etc. Culminates in closeup views of the light-mantled sooty albatross and the synchronous courtship flight of a pair of these birds.

results.title: Beyond the dune
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Depicts birdlife on the salt lagoons of the Coorong, S.A., including banded stilts, cormorants and dotterels. Includes a longer study of the colony of pelicans on Pelican Island, especially the play behaviour and feeding of fledglings. John Olsen’s paintings are featured also in this documentary. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Depicts birdlife on the salt lagoons of the Coorong, S.A., including banded stilts, cormorants and dotterels. Includes a longer study of the colony of pelicans on Pelican Island, especially the play behaviour and feeding of fledglings. John Olsen’s paintings are featured also in this documentary. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Depicts birdlife on the salt lagoons of the Coorong, S.A., including banded stilts, cormorants and dotterels. Includes a longer study of the colony of pelicans on Pelican Island, especially the play behaviour and feeding of fledglings. John Olsen’s paintings are featured also in this documentary. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Birdlife on Townsville Common, showing the osprey, kite, plover, jabiru stork, egret, spoonbill, and heron. Concentrates on the Australian crane, the brolga and in particular its courtship dance,

results.title: Antarctic winter
results.creator_credit: David Parer, Robert Horne and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Emperor and Adelia penguins are shown in their natural habitat during the Antarctic winter playing the “evolutionary game” of adaptation and survival. The penguins are shown travelling to the rookeries, preparing nesting sites, in courtship and mating, breeding, feeding and caring for their chicks.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Emperor and Adelia penguins are shown in their natural habitat during the Antarctic winter playing the “evolutionary game” of adaptation and survival. The penguins are shown travelling to the rookeries, preparing nesting sites, in courtship and mating, breeding, feeding and caring for their chicks.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Emperor and Adelia penguins are shown in their natural habitat during the Antarctic winter playing the “evolutionary game” of adaptation and survival. The penguins are shown travelling to the rookeries, preparing nesting sites, in courtship and mating, breeding, feeding and caring for their chicks.

results.title: Against the escarpment
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
A view of wildlife, mainly birds, in natural surroundings in Arnhem Land. Includes a discussion of threats to the ecological balance. Birds shown include the black banded pigeon, brolga, ibis, pygmy and magpie geese
